intro: Licania turbinata, commonly known as the Turbinated Licania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. Licania turbinata thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat.
